data.title: Operation Smile
data.meta_description: Every year, Operation Smile helps thousands more children living with cleft lip and cleft palate to better breathe, eat, speak and live lives of greater confidence.

Operation Smile Staff Member Katherine Zeveleva shares her experience at a recent surgical program.

Image

Follow their journey as they navigate their experience at one of our surgical programs in Puebla, Mexico.

Image

Dr. Wone Banda is currently the only female certified plastic surgeon delivering care in Malawi.

Content Components

We are Operation Smile, providing

more than 40 years of safe cleft care across the world.

Our founders, Dr. Bill and Kathy Magee, continue to lead the organization, transforming lives through free cleft surgeries and comprehensive care.

Image

Image

Image

Title

What is a cleft condition?

A cleft condition is a gap in the mouth that didn't close during the early stages of pregnancy, and this happens more often than you may realize. It is estimated that, worldwide, a child is born every three minutes with a cleft condition.

Care and Treatment

Title

Comprehensive care from the start to the end.

As well as life-changing cleft surgery, Operation Smile provides comprehensive cleft care including nutrition dentistry, orthodontics, speech therapy, and psychosocial care.

Learn More

Cards

Image

Image

Timely cleft surgery is essential to a patient's long-term health and well-being.

Image

Image

A cleft condition can cause malnourishment. Our nutritional support helps patients grow healthy for surgery.

Image

Image

Dentists provide specialized procedures and create devices that improve patients' surgical results and overall health.

Image

Image

Orthodontic care is also crucial to a patient's healthy oral development and personal confidence.

Image

Image

Certified psychosocial care providers help patients and families throughout the course of their treatment.

Image

Image

Speech therapists help patients speak more clearly and teach parents feeding techniques for their babies.

Where We Work

Title

We are committed to care across the world.

With 6,000 volunteers from around the world, Operation Smile is one of the world's largest volunteer-based nonprofit organizations.

Operation Smile established a presence in Australia in 1999.

Explore our impact in Australia

Operation Smile's first surgical program in Bolivia was held in 1999.

Explore our impact in Bolivia

Get Involved

Title

You can help out and get involved in many ways.

You can give children a chance to grow up without life-threatening health problems, social stigma, isolation, and feelings of hopelessness.

Learn More

Cards

Image

Image

By getting involved with Operation Smile, you can help give children suffering from cleft lips a chance at life-changing surgeries, improved nutrition, and a better future.

Image

Image

The Anthony L. and Hideko S. Burgess Interactive Learning Center in Virginia Beach, Virginia, offers an immersive view of our work.

Image

Image

Leave a legacy that will transform the lives of patients, like Annika, and their families around the world.
